website_summaries.verdict: The addition of a voice remote to this Roku-enabled TV enhances a high-performing unit that is at the top of its class - and a good deal, too.
pros: Offers one of the highest contrast ratios of any 4K TV in its class, and its picture can easily be adjusted to suit the viewer
Onboard Roku is a must for cable cutters
Very thin display makes it a lightweight TV for its size
cons: Screen casting can be a bit spotty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: If you trust the word of a random software developer, here is what I have to say: * The text is quite sharp and it makes a full work day from the couch 100% doable. * All streaming services work very well. 100% recommended for cable cutters * Connecting to my laptop over HDMI works phenomenally * The sound from the TV is actually better than a lot of low end sound bars * Connecting it to my laptop as a wireless display was choppy, but functional. Just plug it in... lol
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lang

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing TV. Not just for the price, but overall, amazing. I just bought an LG that doesn't come close to the clarity and color levels this thing can pump out. Setup was a breeze and the 4K video in amazon is great. The only thing this series doesn't have that the 6 series has is the individual backlight zones. What you get in exchange for that is an incredibly thin display and $150 to spend elsewhere. You will not regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Cap

customer_reviews.title: Worked for ONE day and then the display blew
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this smart TV because of Roku and the decent price. Set it up and was working fine for a day and then the display blew and started showing the white and green stripes (see in picture). Tried to debug for a while, but was not successful. You could tell that the TV was receiving commands from the remote but the display remained in this state. Quite disappointed as I've heard good things about this brand, but will probably go for a more mainstream brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chan

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 months and TCL is very difficult to deal with
customer_reviews.text: TV was wonderful for the first two months, then began to have intermittent flickering and black screen issues on both the home page and any input channels (See the video). Did all troubleshooting steps and problems remain. TCL is dragging their feet on processing the warranty, and not following through on sending emails for verification. Very disappointed. And a huge waste of money at this point. If only Amazon would allow a return for this. Edit: Amazon did eventually make an exception and allowed a return after listening in on a phone call to TCL and experiencing just how impossible it was dealing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer H.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: While this is an acceptable 4k tv for the price, it has a few major flaws. Biggest one? It's advertised as 120hz. It is not, in fact, 120hz. It is 60hz, and uses a few nifty tricks to give the appearance of 120hz. There also seems to be some kind of issue with HPDC, as some programs that attempt to use it end up causing the TV to glitch out, displaying horizontal blue and green bars (or other graphical glitches) until the HDMI cable is unplugged and plugged back in to the TV-side port. I've had this TV for approximately two months. It already has at least 3 distinct clusters of dead pixels.
customer_reviews.author: Colin B.

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive TV for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I got the 55" and I am very impressed with the TV so far. The most surprising thing has to be how low the response time is for gaming, it is significantly more responsive than any of my other TVs, even the small ones.
customer_reviews.author: indubitably

customer_reviews.title: Screen developed a line down the center and double images in less than 10 days.
customer_reviews.text: Screen developed a line down the center and double images in less than 10 days. TV was easy to set up and use. I am in the refund process right now due to the screen issue. This is a real pain for me as I do not have a way to transport a 65" TV hence the reason I ordered one offline. Now I have to transport the defective TV to a UPS location and had to hire a person with a truck for transport to facility. I also order a 43" TCL and it is doing fine. I use that one as a PC monitor for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Walton

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was particularly skeptical when considering this purchase. I had never heard of TCL before this and was seriously considering a Samsung. I'm really glad I extended trust to those taking the time to review this product previously. This is a surprisingly excellent television with great features, ease of use, crystal clear display and great selection of channels and apps.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome TV! But bad dirty screen effect.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m happy with this TV, the color is awesome!!! Especially with Dolby Vision on from Apple TV 4K, picture quality is awesome too when playing 4K movies, I watched several movies that I’ve watched before and then I watched them again in 4K on this TV and I noticed all the details that I’ve missed with 1080P TV. BUT, omg the dirty screen effect is overwhelming! And light leak is pretty bad too, but you won’t notice it unless when ur video is showing majorly white or black scenes.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Skywalker

customer_reviews.title: Roku TV activation
customer_reviews.text: Roku TV can't be register until you pay basic charge of $69.99. Even with message on TV stating that activation and services are free from Roku! This is a false advertisement on behalf of Roku TV. Update: it wasn’t Roku, it was 3rd party tech support that manage to interfere with my registration and posing as Roku. Be aware, do not pay anything and contact Roku directly! Roku registration and support are free with no limit on how many TVs you have.
customer_reviews.author: Dima

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing already
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing already. It’s thin, light, it has a great picture and the voice remote is very handy. It’s also the second TCL tv I’ve bought ( the other one was for my sis).This brand rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Melhorn

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU LIKE FAKE AND LOVE LOW QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: BUYERS BEWARE IF YOU WANT CHEAP YOU GET CHEAP, DO NOT BUY IF YOU APPRECIATE ANY KIND OF DECENT QUALITY. EVERYTHING EXCEPT MAYBE THE PICTURE QUALITY IS COMPLETE CHAOS, NEVER BEFORE HAVE I HAD SO MUCH TROUBLE SETTING UP A TELEVISION. THESE GUYS ARE UNABLE TO GET BACKING FROM ALL THE COMPANIES WE LOVE SO THEY RESORT TO ADS THAT YOU CANT GET RID OF AND CRAP PROGRAMS. Cant even get youtube if that tells you anything. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: TCL Too Successful to Resolve Problem with their TV
customer_reviews.text: After an hour on the phone with TCL support they finally said Sling player doesn't with with the ROKU implementation on the TCL It's being blamed on some iPhone security yet the implementation works well on an external Roku device. This is a major fail for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Buy Buy Buy
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave my 46” 2010 Sony Bravia to my daughter and bought this 55” TCL55S517 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV. It’s fantastic! The picture is incredible. I have the sound coming thru my OINKYO receiver thru speakers (or something like that. Can you tell I didn’t set it up) My understanding is that it was not complicated to set up and if you don’t have a receiver, it will be even easier. I had never heard of TCL. I’ve always been a Sony girl. I looked at reviews all over the net and no one had anything bad to say about this brand. Leap of faith and here it is. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: NY chic

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality on this TV is outstanding. I use it in conjunction with the 4k Apple TV and the images on my screen look creepily lifelike. The best picture quality of any TV I have ever owned and I've owned multiple TVs with this brand. The sound from the built-in speakers is a tad muted but I only watch TV with my AirPods or Google Home Max so its a non-issue for me. For the price point its a no-brainer. BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Refresh rate CANNOT be turned off. Movies will look like soap opera.
customer_reviews.text: Let me save you some time and sanity: if you don’t like your movies to look like the news or soap opera, DO NOT BUY this TV. There is no setting for you to turn off the refresh rate. Other than that, there is serious edge light bleed. The picture quality is average. I mean, you get what you pay for, nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: ABRAHAM D YANG

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 55” TCL in my bedroom that has held up over a year now and I love it. This 65” was a great TV for the first two weeks. Unfortunately, it died the third week and the manufacturer wanted to jerk me around through a warranty process that would take up to another two weeks just to have some third party repairman come and try to fix it. I had to arrange this myself. I didn’t buy a new TV just to stare at the wall for the rest of my summer break, so I instead returned it through Amazon to upgrade to a Samsung two days later.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this is you're planning to use it for gaming!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in my purchase. Let me point out the dirty screen affect and the terrible HDR10 quality. I purchased this tv to go with my new xbox, and all games I play are HDR10 supported. Sadly I'm passed the return date or else I would return it. I waited to buy my xbox for the black Friday deal and i wasn't able to test out the tv until the xbox arrived. Also my xbox said that the Dolby vision isn't compatible because the tv supports and older version. So stupid. Even my old 2015 42" LG tv had a better picture. I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: PHARMACY

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to iPhone hotspot
customer_reviews.text: At first we loved this TV, but now it is hit and miss. Something (well documented in ROKU support pages) has been changed to where, at times, it is impossible to connect to my and my boyfriend’s iPhone hotspot. This has been going on for months and until ROKU gets their act together, I cannot recommend this TV. Stand alone ROKUS connect fine and, this issue is well documented amongst many pissed off iPhone users who are calling this TV a glorified monitor, as that is all it is useful for.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: DEFECT
customer_reviews.text: Can’t tell you how the TV works because the controller can’t even pair with the TV. I’ve never seen anything like this. Then bought a new remote and waited another 2 days to receive it (thanks prime). New remote works! Yay! Not so fast. The TV can now not recognize any WiFi signals... defective hardware. All trouble-shooting proved useless. I now have to unmount this, to return it. Good thing I still have the box, but not sure how I will even get it to ups as it can’t fit in my car. Amazon provided little to no support. Thanks all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Banding and the Corners are black
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend using this display if you plan on using it with grey colors. Didn't notice the banding until I started using apps with a grey background. You might also get corners with little to no lighting.
customer_reviews.author: game username : alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice bedroom TV
customer_reviews.text: I like the Roku interface, using our set with WIFI only, for now. Fairly simple interface, my wife can use it easily. Good picture quality for small edge-lit LCD panel. Brightness won't knock you socks off. HDR OK, Dolby Vision not a noticeable difference from HDR10 (I have a 2017 LG OLED 65" for main TV, so probably biased unfairly on picture quality). Internal speakers not bad for bedroom, I would recommend an Atmos soundbar with woofer, minimum, for any other room.
customer_reviews.author: lakerunr

customer_reviews.title: Overall: Superb TV
customer_reviews.text: Love this TV. Exactly what I needed, Thin, Fast, and amazing picture. Comes with Dolby Atmos and 4K HDR Dolby Vision. Only problem would be that there is color bleeding when full screen is just black. But it's probably just mine. UPDATE: Got another TV that is the same, and this one came out worse. Digital lines everywhere .
customer_reviews.author: Drew R.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tv for several months and I love it. The picture quality is terrific and Roku being built in is a plus. I ended up moving my old tv and roku box to the bedroom, so thst worked out well! If you have used roku before than you know how the menu is setup. Honestly it's very easy. The settings menu is easy to access too and getting the screen set to your preferences is simple. The sound is not great but I have a soundbar. I was really happy with the price on this. I realize it isn't a high end tv but it's great for my purposes since I wanted to upgrade my tv.
customer_reviews.author: molsongrrrl

customer_reviews.title: Direct TV Now issues
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased overall BUT went back to Apple TV 3rd gen since the guide feature on the Direct TV Now function is unwieldy to the point of being almost unuseable! It can take as much as a full minute just to access the guide function. Not the case with the Apple TV, Fire Stick or stand-alone ROKU units that load the guide almost instantly. Severely detracts from an otherwise great unit. Keep hoping that this will be addressed in future software upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: James Sollers

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, just read my review
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at TVs for months and I ended up buying this one. There are so many 4K TVs out there and I was so confused on what to buy. I ended up buying this one and so far I have been very impressed. Picture quality is great and the sound of the TV is really good. I was scared the roku system would be slow but it’s really fast. Surprisingly fast. The frame rate is great for gaming too. I have an Xbox one and a Nintendo switch and both have looked incredible on this TV
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Gifted this TV in late august for wedding. first time opening it for my new house. doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Hello Everyone, I was gifted this TV from our wedding registry in august 25th 2018. we did not open the tv until march 2019 because we wanted to save it for our new home. I installed the TV yesterday and it only worked for a couple of minutes before the screen started flashing different RGB solid colors throughout the screen. The TV literally only worked for a couple of minutes. I know that solid RGB colors means that the TV is in purity mode but I cannot get off of it. this should not be a problem for a tv that was only installed a couple of hours ago.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis morales

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. I have to unplug it and plug in every time I turn it off. See photo attached . I shuld have just spent the extra 200 and gotten Samsung I'm so mad I don't have a television now till I order a new one. This is what comes up on the screen then it t Gos black but you can hear the TV show play in the background
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Knight

customer_reviews.title: At $480.00, This is a Steal !!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Super easy setup -Easy to use remote -Well integrated internet services -HDR -Game Mode -Fast lag response time -Menus switch quickly -Connections: 3 HDMI 2.0, 2 USB 3.0, Audio Out, Cable/Sat/Antenna, AV In, Ethernet, -Remote voice control (very nice) -Incredible picture, blow you away gaming experience. Cons: -With only 3 HDMI (one ARC) it can be a little challenging getting everything hooked up. However, the menus and set up functions are so straightforward and well laid out that I had no trouble connecting my Sat. Tv provider, XBox One X, Wireless headphones, wired headphones and 4K player. Seamless really.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mcmanus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Awesome TV!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome! Video quality is great, WiFi connectivity is flawless. I was able to log on and watch Netflix, spectrum and amazon prime within minutes of opening. USB reader with Roku video player is great, plays almost any video type (except .avi) and Roku interface is really intuitive and easy. I saw that people complained about the advertising on the home screen but it is really nothing, just a still picture of a movie or show from the Roku channel, pretty much a movie poster, not an annoying, loud advertisement. I love this TV!
customer_reviews.author: SGibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this above our fireplace and the picture quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: PhantomDev

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy If you want dimming on Dolby Vision
customer_reviews.text: This tv is great with a huge flaw. Anytime you watch any show on dolby vision it dims in and out from dark and light scenes. I thought it was just my tv but I seen complaints about this, it is really disappointing. I Loved my previous TCL tv but this isn't worth it. For almost 900 dollars you shouldn't have to deal with intense dimming. Aside from this, i love the interface, the 4k and everything about it, I just think the main point of it is the Dolby VIsion, and it is bad.
customer_reviews.author: erick

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, high quality TV
customer_reviews.text: I'm not super knowledgeable when it comes to the 'top' TV's that exist out in the marketplace, however, after doing a little research and looking at reviews, I decided to buy this TV brand. It had very good reviews and it seems to be an 'up and coming' tv brand. I've only had it for one day, however, I really like the picture quality and the sound that comes out of it (without a sound bar or any other sound enhancing technology) is great! I'd definitely recommend to anyone looking to buy an affordable/high quality television.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R. Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV
customer_reviews.text: As noted by other reviewers this TV has issues with Dolby Vision and will flicker the screen for any content that uses it. This means any UHD content from Vudu and any titles available in HDR from Netflix and Amazon Prime. There are other TVs st the same pricepoint that don’t have glaring flaws.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Get the TCL 55 R17 instead
customer_reviews.text: 55inch. I received a used TV. It had no energy sticker and no packing around the screen except for a piece of styrofoam. The 4K picture was great but the HD was poor and the sound was poor as well. I returned it and bought the TCL 55R617 that I’m pretty happy with. Consumer Reports publishes optimal settings for most TV’s I waited home 3 days for a UPS pick up and they never came despite many phone calls. I ended up paying someone with a full sized SUV to help me bring it to a UPS store.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Constant wifi problems
customer_reviews.text: Will keep disconnecting from wifi randomly. For the brief time it is connected the connection is insanely slow. Plus the screen is doing this weird flashing thing on sections of the screen that is dark.
customer_reviews.author: GBS

customer_reviews.title: False advertising. This is a 30hz tv
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these to have a triple monitor 4k setup for a racing simulator. You can only get 30hz out of these tvs. I am so upset needless to say. 1200.00 down the tubes. I should have spent 400- more and got the Samsung's I am used to. Don't waste your money on these if you care about your refresh rate. I will be calling Amazon tomorrow, but I doubt they do anything.
customer_reviews.author: Bayne

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money! Much cheaper then top name brands with good picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great tv for the price. I don’t need anything fancy and super high tech. But wanted good quality picture for a good price. I have the older tcl roku tv version of this 55 inch but without Dolby vision and I must say the Dolby vision in this model is a must have. Definitely a difference in picture quality. I’ve had this tv for 2 months and not one complaint. Great tv so far. Only use tv for streaming. Use separate older tcl for gaming and picture quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: TCL for the win!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at Samsung and lg 4k HDR smart tv's and found this gem. Great picture. Great sound. Fast delivery. Easy set up. I'm in my 2nd month of operation and this tv ended up on Amazon's top 5 best 4k tv's for Xbox one s which is why I purchased it on Rhett first place..gaming! And well well I obviously made a great choice. The right choice. Go TCL if you're tired of LGs customer service Or Samsung's outrageous prices.
customer_reviews.author: airborneanthony22

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is excellent, except for some backlight bleeding around the edges. The roku software is decent, all my favorite apps are available. too bad about the ads. The remote is great, too bad the sling/now/hulu buttons aren't reprogrammable since I don't use those. Sound quality is decent but not great, I wouldn't recommend listening to music. Also the max volume isn't very loud. Installation is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Sounds cuts in and out
customer_reviews.text: Bought TV and the sound went in and out. Was sent replacement which did the same thing. Was told that they could not send another replacement because they would take TV down due to several complaints of the same issue. However I see that the TV is still up. I read many online posts that this is a common issue with Roku tvs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been very happy with this purchase. I did a bunch of research and was weighing oled vs. not, but I couldn’t really justify it for the bedroom. (I have an 55” oled in the living room). This tv was perfect - lightweight, super easy to setup (Roku’s OS) and use. (I didn’t even look at the manual). The ONLY thing I miss from my Apple TV v4 is the right/left one-click 10-second fast forward/back on the remote - I don’t know if this just isn’t a feature of Roku remotes or if I need to go look it up in the manual. RTFM i guess.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: One month and done!
customer_reviews.text: This tv was amazing... The picture was great and the sound. But after one month. The screen was flashing and going black. And then it was turning green. So after one month, my return date was canceled. I talked to tcl customer service( the manufacturer) and they was no help at all. So I contacted Amazon and they agreed to help me out and they asked for me to return it. So If I was you, keep the original box it came in, just in case you have to send it back. Or you may have to buy a TV box for it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh and Heather

customer_reviews.title: Serious quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this TV to replace a 10-year-old plasma screen and Roku 3 that were beginning to show their age. This TV has a fabulous picture quality, is more energy efficient, and is a great deal. No regrets whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Skottikins

customer_reviews.title: A MUST purchase for under $450.00!!!! A++
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed and researched for days for a budget 55” 4K TV. My choice was the TCL 55” 2018 model ($429.99+5% cash back with Discover). I could not be much more impressed with this TV. Picture quality is right up there with higher priced ($599-899) TV’s from the big names. The Roku hub is solid and fast. Easy setup. The 4K picture just blows you away for the price. It’s really a no brainer. TCL is really pushing quality to an affordable price. I will probably purchase another smaller TCL set for the garage.
customer_reviews.author: mtrsprt

customer_reviews.title: Picture is great... internet connection is not ideal.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tv and I love the picture quality. The only complaint I have is that at least 4 times a week in the morning when I turn it on it has lost connection to my internet. It is not a wifi issue, as I literally have it hardwired into my modem. I have to continuously navigate through the settings>system>advanced system settings>network connection reset>reset connection: wait for the tv to restart....just to watch something with my morning coffee. But, if you can get as used to that as I have before brewing your coffee in the morning I'm sure you will have no other problems with this tv!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Castonguay

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to disregard reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute worst TV, as other people have said in the reviews the TV is very dark. Also could not adjust colors or have a very good picture,lost internet connection continuously even though there was a strong signal. Several times upon being turned on there had no picture except red and green lines. Roku and set up were the only good thing about this TV. My 7 year old 1080p Samsung TV has much better pic... wanted to disregard bad reviews and did till I purchased and tried to use it. I should have listened to those reviews!!! If you purchase this TV I wish you good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: No frills. Great picture. Sound isn't too shabby either. Easy to set up. Packaging could be better - mine was nearly falling out of the box upon delivery - but damage free. If you've ever used Roku, it will be intuitive. First time Roku users - it *IS* a Roku-based TV - may experience some learning-curve issues. I had some WiFi wireless connection issues with buffering (most likely insufficient bandwidth at my house with 30+ things connected to the network) so I ran a CAT-5 wire directly from the router to the TV and the problem ceased. Excellent bang for the buck! Thinking of buying another one now...
customer_reviews.author: Safadinho

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this TV. I started off with a Roku Express on my old CRT TV and liked it so decided to get this Roku TV. Granted, it's a big step up from my 25". I had some connection problems with the Roku Express but absolutely none with the TV. And it's set back into a recess by my fireplace and still works great with a very slow internet connection. I've cut the cable cord and couldn't be happier. I've had much more to watch with this Roku TV than I did with Verizon TV service. Can't wait for the new TV shows to start so I can watch them on my new BIG TV! Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This TLC-Roku TV was a great acquisition. It has true 4K Ultra HD for a really low price. This one is a 55" (diagonal measure). This model has the slim border which gives a slick look. The Roku software is easy to use. The control functions great and has a nice soft feel in the hand. The TV works great with our 5G internet. Netflix, Amazon Prime, Twiched, ABC, PBS, etc. apps run great on it. So far no complains at all. I like it so much that I bought another one (a 49 inch one). Hopefully this TV can pass the test of time too, we will see.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Best buy in a 4K UHDTV
customer_reviews.text: For the price I couldn't be happier. I can utilize Amazon Prime TV wirelessly, stream LOTS of FREE video, TV shows (other than over-the-air), rent movies, etc. which I couldn't do with my older TVs. And the picture is like watching live-action. Even old movies look like live-action, soap opera quality. Even the wife compliments me on my choice. Just be careful with volume. Over-the-air programs can be heard fine at about 20-30 points, but when streaming or playing DVDs you have to crank it up to 50-60 or better, unless you turn the volume off altogether and just use your surround-sound system for DVDs. Small concession for an, otherwise, GREAT TV.
customer_reviews.author: roguecop55

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months later and this is what my screen looks like
customer_reviews.text: Waste of Money. TV was fine for 6 moths and now this is what the TV looks like. i've called TCL's number and either put on hold forever or nothing. What a waste. Will not suggest buying this brand, or going through Amazon to get a TV, because now I'm left with a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: really that the price is very good for what the tv offers I think it even offers more for the price since I have tried it quite a lot in games on my ps4 and the games really look amazing an excellent tv to play
customer_reviews.author: johan manuel perez sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Know the value of the picture and sound and don’t go for this just because of the price
customer_reviews.text: OTA instead of cable but the tuner is not as good as the Visio it replaces. Picture is fine, but not great. Sound was meh. Price was good and I lowered my bar in consideration but in the end you buy a TV for the viewing pleasure and the good deal gets forgotten OK, I downloaded the iphone remote for the ROKU per comment in case it was a boon. Turns out, to actually get use out of it you must purchase the swipe feature and for more $ the keyboard?!?! OK, I am not taking another star away because I don't need the feature, but charging to use a remote is lame.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: picture issues -blotches -color bleed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 49" Roku Smart TV in December 2018. The Smart feature is great and like the Roku remote features, but the picture quality has issues. In darker scenes, there are black blotches, perhaps bleed through? Ex,. a person wearing a black coat in lower light level scenes looks blotchy. It's very distracting and have tried multiple times to adjust the picture options to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Debsy

customer_reviews.title: Roku is very easy to use, good buy
customer_reviews.text: First set delivered had a picture issue with the blacks and when the scene was low-lit it pixilated. After trying all of the possible picture adjustments we were unable to fix it. Amazon immediately sent a replacement and we packed up and sent the first TV back. New picture is much improved (although blacks are just a bit 'fluid' to me). The Roku functionality is great and very easy to use-makes it simple to find shows and movies. For the price I think this is a very good purchase although we have only had it a month so who knows. We bought the 49" size and it's just right for our living room.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Agave Press Consignment

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love the t.v. I wanted an inexpensive television to go outside on my deck. This one could be put anywhere in my house and i would be satisfied! Picture is just as good as any Samsung that i have bought and the Roku features work great. It streams well with very few interruptions. I use it strictly for streaming. I have no cables attached to it. I would highly recommend this television for any application.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this TV
customer_reviews.text: I am sitting here in my living room on a Sunday afternoon trying to relax, but can't seem to get past the smell of the TV I bought over three weeks ago. Yup, some kind of funky plastic, chemical smell. I have read up on them, and I am hoping this smell goes away. Until it does, save the gas mask for me. The smell gets around you..... PS The TV also crashes and you can't access menu and you have to reset it every time you wanna watch the tv. Faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cipes

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade and built-in Roku is a huge bonus
customer_reviews.text: A very good picture with Dolby Vision, HDR and all the goodies I wanted in a 4k TV plus the Roku. I've had stand alone Roku's for years but my cousin told me to try the TCL TV's with Roku built-in. They are more responsive and are much better for watching streaming services like Amazon than any SmartTV, Tivo, AppleTV, etc.. I've ever tried. Incredible picture with 4k streaming from Amazon and Netflix. Awesome value for money. I would have gone for the 6 series but I could not fit it where this one was going. If I did not already have other TV's in the house, I would probably buy all 4k TCL's with Roku.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: TV frame is noticeably bent!!
customer_reviews.text: The Frame for the tv is noticeably bent. Considering the box it was shipped in was not damaged, I’m assuming it was either built this way or damaged before it left the factory. Although the screen seems ok, i will be returning as 1) it’s quite noticeable and unsightly and 2) im concerned perhaps the bent frame is a result of some damage that may cause other problems which i don’t notice now but may with the TV down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Picture
customer_reviews.text: We did not know anything about 4K technology, only that our old plasma tv was on its last legs. The picture on this new TCL television is just astounding. There's a depth perception that makes it almost 3D, without the gimmicky aspect. Setting it up was logical and simple. The inputs are in a convenient place and well marked. There is a dialogue setting on the sound that helps make speech more distinguishable. The color is absolutely realistic right out of the box. If you haven't purchased a tv in years, the new ones are light weight and efficient. I could not recommend the TCL more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: tv shut off after 6 months and tcl customer care assures me itwill be fixed but waiting.............
customer_reviews.text: i bought this tv in april 2019. it is now november 2019 and the tv has shut itself off and will not turn back on. I have called india customer service 2 times and do not receive the awaited for email with my repair details or case number. i then also sent an email and surprise, nothing either. until this i really had no issues and like the tv BUT now it seems they do not want to do anything idk. buy amazon warranty if offered is my suggestion cause who know if or when i will actually have tcl do anything
customer_reviews.author: Missy Buys

customer_reviews.title: No one will help me replace this item !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. Way over priced and found 65” better tv for same price I spent on this 55” Sound is horrible and pic is not impressive
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Van Winkle

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: TURN SHARPNESS TO ZERO This TV is great was skeptical after reading reviews but the picture quality is great if you're on a completely black screen you can sometimes see I guess like a fade in the picture but while watching something or anything with color I can't ever see it. The speakers aren't great I use a home theater system the Roku system itself works wonderful never had a problem with it the remote works great was easy to set up Four to five stars just because in some action movies the pictures can get blurry. But this can be fixed by turning the sharpness off.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Smart features exceeded expectations. I thought it would be slow but it’s just as fast if not faster than Roku 3. Picture is great, only giving it 4 stars because there’s not much 4K content so through cable and Netflix cost more. Haven’t gotten to try it...could be great. I wish the remote had a headphone jack, like Roku remotes. You can listen through the app on your phone. I have not seen any ads as others have commented about. Maybe they start after Amazon asks you to review? Wouldn’t be surprised
customer_reviews.author: RSUNC10

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect premium quality despite the reviews
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on many websites made this tv sound amazing. Picture needs ton of adjustments just to match my 7 year old Toshiba 1080p tv. I guess I was just expecting to be wowed by my first 4k TV. Not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Adam May

customer_reviews.title: Dead 3 months after warranty
customer_reviews.text: Was a great deal, relatively good color and brightness for the price. Performed well for streaming for 1 year and 3 months. Nice purchase and compared well to higher priced brands. But the backlight just died on me. I would have expected at least a couple years out of this purchase, but nope. And the warranty is only good for a year. If you had asked me a week ago I would have given this a 4 star review. But a thousand dollar purchase should probably last longer than this TV did.
customer_reviews.author: kreg

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flickers Constantly
customer_reviews.text: Brand new TV and flickers constantly out the box. Can't get in touch with any TCL representatives to fix issue. Do not recommend purchasing this TV, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Council

customer_reviews.title: Love this TV
customer_reviews.text: I have heard mixed reviews, but have had this TV for awhile now and absolutely love it - to the point I bought the 65" for my living room. The interface is not flashy, but I like that. It's extremely user friendly and has everything I need. The remote is one of my favorite things - no more using a TV then soundbar, etc.; it's all in one remote to control everything. I switched from cable to YouTubeTV (which I also swear by) and now I don't even have a cable remote, just the Roku remote that comes with the TV to control TV, soundbar, streaming TV, switching between inputs for gaming. nothing but positives so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Dowell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: After our 4 year old 55 inch LG tv died I started shopping around and watching reviews. I was just about to pull the trigger on the 6 series but with all the negative reviews about the banding it I narrowed it down to the 5 series 65 inch and pulled the trigger. Boy am I happy this tv looks amazing and the build is pretty solid. The Roku which this is my first time to use is great and very easy to use. Love the voice activation. With the money I saved 200 bucks that is I ordered a new stand for it.
customer_reviews.author: John77

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found anything I don't like about this TV. Perfect picture, great features, simple instructions, what's not to like? Well, if you want the features high priced units incorporate go for it. If you want a great TV, incredible price and next day shipping (Prime) don't hesitate to buy this unit. I did add a soundbar but that is to be expected with any TV.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Weis Sr.

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this television. Perhaps it was that I went from 24 inches to 49 inches and can now read sub-titles much more easily, but this TV was put together by one person, alone. If you have a friend, it might be easier, but it can be done by one person. Glad I decided to get it. ROKU worked right away as well. Thank you, TCL.
customer_reviews.author: MADPHD

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Trust The 4 Star Reviews
customer_reviews.text: I tried for a couple days to dial in a decent picture, but it was a lost cause. Our old plasma TV gets a picture that is twice as good as this thing. I've had a few dozen TVs, at this point in my life, and I spent a few years selling TVs, so I know how to dial in a good picture. I tried a 4K blu-ray player, Amazon Prime & Netflix, all to no avail. This is not a good TV . . .
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming interface for cord cutters , good but not great picture quality, very good sound.
customer_reviews.text: The 55” TCL 5 series TV is one of the best TVs on the market for the budget conscious Cord cutter. The Roku interface is the best streaming platform available and the minimalist remote supplied with the TV works flawlessly. The picture is good not great- if this is your sole/ main TV I recommend upgrading to the 6 series which has the same interface with a markedly superior picture. The sound is surprisingly good and is comparable to a basic sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: AKR1

customer_reviews.title: App enabled
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty awesome TV. What's best about it is you having the ability to use it with or without cable. It's wi-fi enabled so even without cable, you are able to customize to some of your favorite shows via apps. Maybe this is common now but for me, it's great. My daughter cut the cable cord but is able to get most of her favorites anyway on her home TV. I purchased a second for my house which has cable and i can go either way, with or without. Great picture too!
customer_reviews.author: TruthbKnown

customer_reviews.title: Not well made/Roku account forced on you
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality was fine. Limited hdmi inputs and the placements of the outlets is not user friendly. The fact that you have to create a Roku account to watch your TLC tv is disturbing. The frame is rather flimsy and I was afraid it would brake during the wall mounting.
customer_reviews.author: TReycox3

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: This TV works great for about six months we loved it. Then without warning or without problem it just stopped working. We reached out to the seller and they would not talk back so buy with caution. Delivered from Costco truck so my advice don't buy from these guys buy from Costco!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Tooth Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Shocking value. The fact that you can get a 65" with HDR and all the Roku apps built in...... VERY happy with this purchase. I could not get the Roku Media Player to work with my DLNA media server though (video worked but not audio) so I still have a FireTV box connected just for using Kodi to view my media library. The remote leaves a lot to be desired, but it is IR and works well enough until you get a harmony setup. There is also a TCL or Roku app that can be used for advanced TV configuration and I believe as a remote. For the price you can afford to get a soundbar and programmable remote!
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is as big as I'd like (I don't think larger would be better). It is great for movies, football, and oldies. The set up is easy, and it is flexible with online connections. The remote is a pain. It is simple, with very few settings, but the buttons are too sensitive. If you set it down too hard it will change channels, or turn off. Additionally, there is no button to return to the previous channel. I mounted mine on the wall, and it worked beautifully. The TV is not heavy, and is easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture quality. The Roku user interface is great and easy to use. Very easy to switch between imput signals. The audio is also very good. I really like the remote control. I only wish there was a headphone jack in the remote like in some of the Roku models. Still a great TV. I am planning to buy another one for my other room.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Lukevich

customer_reviews.title: Not at all a bad option
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and worked as advertised. As others have mentioned, the sound isn't the greatest quality, but I suppose that's to be expected with the thin bezel (which leaves no room for decent sized speakers). Great picture quality, smooth frame rates, Game Mode works well with Steam Box streaming (smooth and clear quality), and the smart features work as advertised. Biggest complaint is that the Roku remote that comes with TV seems lower quality than standard Roku remotes (lesser battery life, odd range, delayed response) but otherwise works as advertised. Worth the $$$ and worth the set-up time
customer_reviews.author: Tabor J. Cleberg

customer_reviews.title: I'm so sad this stopped working because this was my favorite tv ever
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS TV. It had a hardware issue that gave out just past the return window. It had a 1 year warranty but TCL is dragging their feet and keeps asking for more information even though they know this is a pre-existing issue. Rediculous, I would give this negative stars based on their customer support. Save yourself the time and pay an extra $100 for a way more reliable TV. This was my favorite TV ever until half the screen stopped working. I've had it for a month and two days. Return window is out, so I'm praying amazon accommodates me. I'm so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Drake

customer_reviews.title: The TCL TV is very easy Setup. I got this TV to play Fortnite ...
customer_reviews.text: The TCL TV is very easy Setup. I got this TV to play Fortnite on my Xbox One X. The quality is very good and easy to adjust for gaming purposes. Cheaper end for 4k TVs but the product matches other high-end 4K TVs that cost twice as much. Very happy I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jordant23

customer_reviews.title: SLOW REFRESH RATE
customer_reviews.text: TCL claims the refresh rate is 120hz, but it is NOT. The actual rate is 60hz. I'm not sure how they can fraudulently claim 120hz. I watch a lot of sports, but also old movies. ALL moving objects are ghosted/pixelized. Very bad performance.
customer_reviews.author: Clark H Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great picture black levels are really good and color is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This TV looks great. The 617 is the model to buy. Looks like the Samsung QLED TV. Thin at top similar to the word. Picture quality is amazing. I saw the 615 at another store and was not impressed with the look of the thickness of the TV. When I opened the box I was extremely pleased with how things it is. The ROKU software is just so easy. Love love love the TCL 617 model and the price was crazy good
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rucker

customer_reviews.title: backlight goes out on this model
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tv july 2019. apparently it was refurbished. TV worked great for a year! Then this morning, apparently the back light went out and you cannot see the picture. Called TCL, excellent customer service and he walked me through all trouble shooting and was super helpful and calm. determined that the back lights went out and it is not under warranty since it was refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Kim311

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the price, although sacrifices were made...
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled with the amount of TV I bought for the price here. Nice big 55" screen, smart TV, 4k definition, etc. The picture and sound quality is average. The built in wireless is god awful. It loses connection constantly even with the wireless router sitting right next to it and free of any obstructions. If you're looking to cord cut, look elsewhere or make sure you're connecting with an ethernet cord. Overall, I'm content with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: TCL 55S517 55-Inch Ultra HD ROKU Smart LED TV
customer_reviews.text: Excellent TV and picture quality for the price. Menu is very user-friendly, simple to use, and expedient in its retrieval/action. Also, it cost less than $30.00 to purchase an extended 4-year warranty...That says a lot about standing behind the quality of one's product. Unlike Samsung, who will charge you close to $200.00 for only a year's extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: CH3CKRAIS3R

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Got a "Prime Day" deal on this. Was skeptical buying a Chinese set, but for the money it offered a lot of great amenities. I really love the set! The integration with Roku is personally a big plus, as I am a streamer. The picture is great, the sound is the only thing that is not super but I had planned on augmenting that anyways. The 120 refresh rate is a big deal for me because I also use it as a computer monitor when I play games. Buy this set, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Bickel

customer_reviews.title: Once i got a working one it was a star
customer_reviews.text: So this took 2 tries to get it right. The first one showed up with a bent corner on the panel and a damaged screen. The second one showed up just fine. Is the picture going to take your breath away and suck you into another dimension? No... but for what it costs the picture is fantastic. Mine is darker than I was expecting compared to my Sanyo but it was set to "low power" picture mode. Changing that to normal brightened the picture but i still think it might struggle in a brightly lit room.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bernardi

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good picture, yet not as sharp, colors not as bright as top brands like Sony, Samsung or LG. Very good - small, simple to use and perfectly functioning remote. No need to look at it while surfing through channels, adjusting volume or anything. Roku works well, without a glitch, yet there are not a lot of quality freebies. I was unable to find anything free in 4k.
customer_reviews.author: VladM

customer_reviews.title: What a beautiful picture!
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful picture! At this price, there was no competition for a true 120 MHz 4K TV. I was a little nervous about a brand that didn’t have the name cachet, but I am pleasantly surprised. The picture is gorgeous, Roku is easy to set up, all of the options for Video streaming are excellent. I get all the same channels that I want and as I did with my satellite TV. I couldn’t be happier. The only area that could be improved is really with the Roku service. I wish that the voice control would work with the in the applications.
customer_reviews.author: PhxCoronado

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use/Good Value
customer_reviews.text: We have used a Roku stick for the mostly online viewing we do for a number of years and enjoyed its ease of use. When we needed a new TV, we looked at ratings from a number of sources before deciding on this TV. We had no difficulty setting it up and using it and find it works well for us. Picture quality is good although we don't watch many HD offerings. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Display died within a month
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last a month before the display started showing dark spots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is dying not even 2 months later.
customer_reviews.text: Screen now intermittently flickers not even two months later. Sometimes the bottom inch or two just turns off. Restarting TV gets it to reappear.
customer_reviews.author: Scot H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice TV
customer_reviews.text: TV works great. Have had no issues with the picture. I use a Vizio sound bar with the TV. Only annoyance is with DirecTV. I have to use the TCL remote to select the input when I use the DirecTV remote. I’m sure there is a workaround but I haven’t been annoyed enough to search for a fix. Overall, I’m happy with the TV.
customer_reviews.author: S. Patel

customer_reviews.title: For price, it is good.
customer_reviews.text: This tv has picture quality issues. I have played with the tv picture quality. You will always have too crisp a picture. Gives every show an "on set" picture. Good luck trying to fix. In addition, tv is quirky about receiver sound. Many times, I have to enable and disable speakers on tv to maintain my receiver speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Dbags

customer_reviews.title: Cool 4k Tv
customer_reviews.text: Tcl 5 series TV is excellent 4k TV for a price point of 349 bucks. If you are using external Roku then this is the best upgrade you will have, as Roku interface is built in and better. We continued to watch Sling, Netflix and YouTube without ever learning anything. One small thing I would have liked better are the TV stands. The are plastic-ky and the 49 inch TV is somewhat heavy too. A solid stand would been better. Otherwise I am very happy with the purchase. Port wise it has all the standard ports + ethernet port.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Could see the picture cause the screen was broke on arrival
customer_reviews.text: This TV came with a spiderweb of a crack in the screen. This had no visible damage to the box but the screen was screwed up I bet the TV is great but this is simply my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Just in time for Superbowl.
customer_reviews.text: I sent back THREE ‘refurbished’ tvs before getting this one. I love it. And i love the smell of new electronics (unmistakeable, u can always tell by the smell.). Thank you Amazon for taking care of your customer and making sure i picked a really nice set in time for the Superbowl. The broadcast is only 1080i but you’d swear you were in the huddle. Picture is amazing but with HDR and 4K some of the online stuff is JAW DROPPING.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

product_meta.title: TCL 49S517 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2018 Model)
product_meta.description: Size:49-Inch| Configuration:TV onlyThe 5 series 4K TCL Roku TV delivers stunning Ultra HD picture quality with four times the resolution of Full HD for enhanced clarity and detail, as well as the most streaming channels of any 4K TV. To make the most of all this content, Dolby Vision high dynamic range (HDR) technology delivers bright and accurate colors for a lifelike viewing experience. In addition, your favorite HD shows, movies, and sporting events are upscaled to near Ultra HD resolution with 4K upscaling. The simple, intuitive interface allows seamless access to over 500, 000 streaming movies and TV episodes, your cable box, Blu ray player, gaming console, and other devices without flipping through inputs or complicated menus.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One TCL 49-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV, 2018 Model – 49S517, One start guide, one Remote control Roku TV RC580 with batteries

Pairs 4K ultra HD picture clarity with the contrast, color, and detail of Dolby Vision high dynamic range (HDR) for the most lifelike picture. With the combination of 4K ultra HD, HDR support, a dedicated game mode, and an amazingly low input lag, this is one of the best reviewed gaming TVs out there!
Smart functionality offers access to thousands of streaming channels featuring more than 500,000 movies and TV episodes via Roku TV. Contrast Control Zones is not included in 5 Series.
